Beginner Vocabulary - Page 6

Beginner

Beginner Vocabulary - Page 6

Learn important words for talking about family members and people. These words are essential for introducing yourself and others!

Navigation

This is page 6 of 9. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Mother

/ˈmʌðər/

noun

A female parent.

"My mother cooks delicious food."

Category: Family

Father

/ˈfɑːðər/

noun

A male parent.

"My father works in an office."

Category: Family

Brother

/ˈbrʌðər/

noun

A male sibling.

"My brother is younger than me."

Category: Family

Sister

/ˈsɪstər/

noun

A female sibling.

"My sister lives in another city."

Category: Family

Child

/tʃaɪld/

noun

A young human being.

"The child is playing in the park."

Category: Family

Baby

/ˈbeɪbi/

noun

A very young child.

"The baby is sleeping."

Category: Family

Man

/mæn/

noun

An adult male human.

"The man is wearing a suit."

Category: People

Woman

/ˈwʊmən/

noun

An adult female human.

"The woman is reading a book."

Category: People

Boy

/bɔɪ/

noun

A male child or young man.

"The boy is playing football."

Category: People

Girl

/ɡɜːrl/

noun

A female child or young woman.

"The girl is singing beautifully."

Category: People

Person

/ˈpɜːrsən/

noun

An individual human being.

"She is a very kind person."

Category: People

People

/ˈpiːpəl/

noun

More than one person; human beings in general.

"Many people came to the party."

Category: People
